title: Science Idea Generation Design Based on Predictive Cognitive Load in Collaborative Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of core concepts and intermediate-level application skills
context.additional_context: Learners possess intermediate expertise in science and participate in online collaborative learning using digital devices (tablets/laptops). During the course, neuroscience-based data collection techniques (fNIRS/eye-tracking) are indirectly explained, with actual application noted to occur at the research level.

learning_goals: Learners can categorize cognitive load stages (low/medium/high) that occur during collaborative learning into three levels.
Learners can explain the core principles (three key features) of a cognitive load prediction model based on fNIRS and eye-tracking data.
Learners can apply at least two cognitive load optimization strategies (e.g., task division, feedback cycles) when designing collaborative idea-generation tasks.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
